ooda-loop-discipline.name: OODA Loop Discipline
ooda-loop-discipline.description: Every operation follows Observe-Orient-Decide-Act at appropriate timescale

no-causal-guessing.name: No Causal Guessing
no-causal-guessing.description: When asked why something happened, investigate first. Never generate plausible-sounding explanations without evidence.

verify-before-claim.name: Verify Before Claim
verify-before-claim.description: Never say 'probably' or 'might be'. Verify with tools before making any claim about file existence, code presence, or feature state.

spiral-detection.name: Spiral Detection
spiral-detection.description: Monitor for oscillation, scope creep, diminishing returns, and thrashing. Stop and escalate when detected.

tdd-workflow.name: TDD Workflow
tdd-workflow.description: Types → Tests (red) → Implementation (green) → Refactor. Factory pattern with shared test helpers.

file-based-agent-memory.name: File-Based Agent Memory
file-based-agent-memory.description: Agents share state through files (progress.md, session-handoff.json), not conversation. From C compiler project pattern.

background-agent-spawning.name: Background Agent Spawning
background-agent-spawning.description: Always spawn team agents with run_in_background: true and subagent_type: 'general-purpose'. Without background, no task_id for force-kill.

escalation-over-autonomy.name: Escalation Over Autonomy
escalation-over-autonomy.description: System handles diligence; human handles judgment. Present structured decision requests, not open-ended questions.

conventional-commits.name: Conventional Commits
conventional-commits.description: All commits use conventional format: feat/fix/perf/refactor/docs/test/chore/security. Automated changelog depends on it.

hub-structured-dialectic.name: Hub Structured Dialectic
hub-structured-dialectic.description: Multi-agent coordination uses CLAIM/REFUTE/SYNTHESIS in Hub channels. Proposals require reviews. Consensus requires agreement.
